intro: Machaeranthera rhizomata, commonly known as the prairie blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy yellow to orange flower heads. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and grasslands. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Machaeranthera rhizomata is a valuable component of native plant communities and supports various pollinators.
